data.title: Blender exported 3D model texture is somehow flipped on Y-axis
data.body:
The model in Blender:
![blender](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1974284/3007432/d6f112c2-de85-11e3-93d4-8973213cff9d.png)

.obj export in MeshLab:
![meshlab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1974284/3007435/08450ab8-de86-11e3-99c6-54dd19f4fc90.png)

.g3db (converted from .fbx export) or .obj in libgdx:
![libgdx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1974284/3007437/56ea2036-de86-11e3-9745-7c08a9ee8381.png)

However, when you go and vertically mirror the texture image with an image editor:
![libgdx1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1974284/3007446/f76bb326-de86-11e3-978c-88c6d76797ba.png)

This issue can be directly recreated by running the project in https://github.com/ayberkozgur/libgdx-model-viewer under the `texflip` branch. The offending model and texture can be found under https://github.com/ayberkozgur/libgdx-model-viewer/tree/texflip/android/assets/robot4.

data.title: No Gdx.getInputProcessor() function
data.body: A `Gdx.getInputProcessor()` function would be useful for people using `InputMultiplexer`'s who want to be able to have a bunch of different classes add their `InputProcessor` to the main `InputMultiplexer`.

data.title: Box2d has Motor Joint but libgdx don't has MotorJoint.class and MotorJointDef
data.body:
Hi!
I see that, Box2d has Motor Joint but in libdgdx 1.0.0 don't have MotorJoint.class and MotorJointDef to use.
Please update them for us to use.
Thanks in advance!

data.title: Ouya controllers listed twice

In Firefox, the controllers manager successfully initializes, but Controllers.getControllers() never has any controller objects.
Works fine in Chrome.

data.title: Detecting enter pressed on iOS software keyboard.
data.body: Pressing "Done" button while RoboVM software keyboard is up should trigger keyDown() or keyTyped() event. Currently most of custom textfields (just like the one from flixel-gdx) don't work because "Done" button just closes virtual keyboard without triggering any event. Invoking keyTyped for '\n' keycode would be a nice idea.

data.title: GwtControllers debug logging
data.body: On the `GwtControllers` class, there seems to be some leftover debugging code. When you press the button 0, something is printed on the console.

data.title: Pool/ReflectionPool acting up
data.body:
I've been modifying my code to use a ReflectionPool to create objects that I create very frequently. This is, of course, to reduce GC time on Android. However, I've been encountering some problems with the pool. Every now and then, Pool.obtain() will return a null value, and sometimes, I get this error when calling Pool.obtain():

> Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" Exception in thread "Thread-1" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Array is empty.
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array.pop(Array.java:292)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Pool.obtain(Pool.java:50)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.Collisions.HitBox.ContainsPoint(HitBox.java:18)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.CaseContent.Location.Update(Location.java:1013)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.CaseContent.Area.Update(Area.java:71)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.CaseInformation.Case.Update(Case.java:412)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.Screens.GameScreen.Update(GameScreen.java:157)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.Game.update(Game.java:287)
>     at org.spacehq.mylittleinvestigationsjava.Game.render(Game.java:252)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.Game.render(Game.java:46)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:206)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:114)

The line of code in this stack trace that calls Pool.obtain() is this:

> CollisionParameter tempParam = CollisionParameter.POOL.obtain();

and I later free it like so:

> CollisionParameter.POOL.free(tempParam);

I'm creating the pool like so:

> public static final Pool<CollisionParameter> POOL = new ReflectionPool<CollisionParameter>(CollisionParameter.class);

As for the problem of pools returning null, I don't have any clues as to why that happens, however if I manually create an instance and free it to the pool when Pool.obtain() returns null, then calling it again will return an object instance (Likely the one I just created).

data.title: Add Advanced settings to Gradle, fixes #1792, speed up gradle by default
data.body:
**Ui Tweaks**
- Reduce height of logo, more space for the feedback text box
- Add advanced settings dialog
- Fix exit signs on prompts from exiting incorrectly
- Remove ability to put yourself on Nightlies in the setup, if you don't know how to do it yourself, you shouldn't be using them.

**Android Tweaks**
- We now use build tools 19.1.0 (Will be added to CHANGES if/when merged? Those conflicts...)
- I have removed `resources.srcDirs = ['src']` as this is causing issues when importing the generated .ipr file into Intellij IDEA after using the IDEA task.  

**Gradle Tweaks**
- gradle.properties is now packed, with settings for daemon and configuration on demand true
  - Enables the Gradle Daemon
  - Configuration on Demand lets us run projects without configuring all the other projects that our project does not depend on.
    (Most users will want these options as they drastically improve task times when running via Gradle, users that don't want the extra RAM usages are _probably?_ in the minority, so they can opt out)
- There is also now support for adding your own Mirror url to replace MavenCentral.
  ![this](http://i.imgur.com/gc3VZrz.png)

data.title: Added a separated Colors class.
data.body:
Colors used by the BitmapFontCache markup language are now in a separated class which is more general purpose. The user can define his own colors.
Also added to the Color class some constants for those colors whose chromatic components are a combination of 0.5 and 0.

Should I move the Colors class from graphics to utils?

data.title: SelectBox tries to access optional ScrollPaneStyle element without null check
data.body:
The `layout()` method of `SelectBox` tries to access an element of a `ScrollPaneStyle` instance that is marked optional without checking to see if it exists.
Thus, if you pass `SelectBox`'s constructor a `SelectBoxStyle` which in turn was initialized with a `ScrollPaneStyle` (required) that has not had its `background` element initialized (optional), `SelectBox` throws a `NullPointerException`.

Code:
`SelectBox` accesses optional `ScrollPaneStyle` element without a null check [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/SelectBox.java#L159).
`ScrollPaneStyle.background` is marked optional [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/ScrollPane.java#L964).

data.title: Added color markup.
data.body:
Continuing from discussion https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/908

Markup syntax:
- **[name]** Sets the color by name. Names are currently hard-coded into a private static `ObjectMap<String,Color>` containing the same colors defined as constants in the Color class.
- **[#xxxxxxxx]** Sets the color specified by the hex value xxxxxxxx in the form  RRGGBBAA where AA is optional and defaults to 0xFF.
- **[]** Sets the color to the previous color (kind of optional end tag)
- **[[** Escapes the left bracket.

Color names are case-sensitive, cannot be empty, cannot start with `#` and cannot contain `]`. They can contain unescaped `[` though.

Markup is disabled by default. Use BitmapFont.setMarkupEnabled() to turn it on/off.

Support for user defined color names not implemented yet. Should they be stored in a static or member map?

data.title: SpriteBatch does not handle DisplayMode changes correctly
data.body:
SpriteBatch Projection matrix is initialized only once in constructor.
Therefore when displaymode changes, the projection matrix set to initial Gdx.graphics.getWidth()/getHeight() is no more valid.

Workaround : I set 

``` java
spriteBatch.getProjectionMatrix().setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
```

just before 

``` java
spriteBatch.begin()
```

Solution: You could include the projection matrix setup in the begin() function.

Thank you and keep up the good work

data.body: To issue #1579

data.title: Image setColor(Color) affects everything which is drawn by the same batch the image is using
data.body:
When I set a color of an Image instance (Scene2d) every drawable gets affected by this color change which is drawn by the same batch. The reason is that the color isn't reset in the Image.draw() method after the batch has finished drawing.
I suppose this isn't intended.
